Executive Assistant Job at Digitvant Microfinance Bank




        
    

        
        Digitvant Microfinance Bank - We offer a comprehensive digital banking experience, featuring savings, loans, fund transfers, and online payments via our website and App. Our platform allows customers to manage their finances efficiently and access a wide range of personalised services to meet evolving needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Provide high-level administrative support to the Managing Director
	Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and coordinate appointments
	Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, and presentations
	Organize and maintain confidential files and documents
	Handle travel arrangements, expense reports, and logistics
	Serve as the point of contact between the executive team and internal/external stakeholders
	Attend meetings, take minutes, and follow up on action items
	Perform ad-hoc administrative tasks as assigned


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, or any related field
	Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or in a similar administrative role
	Exceptional organizational and time-management skills
	Strong written and verbal communication abilities
	High level of discretion and confidentiality
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and digital productivity tools
	Ability to multitask and work well under pressure


Preferred Qualities:


	Experience in a fast-paced corporate environment
	Strong interpersonal skills and professional presence
	Problem-solving mindset and ability to anticipate needs


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: b.owoyemi@digitvant.com and hr@digitvant.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Videographer Job at Yemsays Properties and Investment Limited




        
    

        
        Yemsays Properties and Investment Limited is a leading real estate firm based in Lagos, Nigeria, specializing in property development, investment, and marketing. We are committed to providing top-notch services that connect clients with the best real estate opportunities, ensuring transparency, innovation, and excellence in all our dealings.
     

            
    



At Yemsays, we pride ourselves on our dynamic team, which works tirelessly to deliver exceptional results. We foster a collaborative and professional work environment where every team member’s input is valued and growth is encouraged. Job Position: Videographer

	Are you a creative videographer with an eye for storytelling and the skills to operate a drone?
	Join our fast-paced real estate marketing team at Yemsays Properties and bring stunning visuals to life!


What We’re Looking For


	Proficient in video shooting and editing
	Skilled in drone operation

	Strong sense of pacing, storytelling, and transitions
	Experience with color grading and adding branded elements
	Preferably lives around Lekki-Ajah for easy mobility.


Skills:
Bonus if you:


	Can work under tight deadlines
	Have a portfolio of real estate or lifestyle content
	Are familiar with editing softwares.


Salary


	Salary: N120,000 - N200,000 Monthly.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV + Portfolio (with real-life video edits) and any sample drone footage to: yemsaysproperties@gmail.com using "Videographer Application" as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "General Manager",
  "description": "Quest Realtor &amp; Consulting Services&nbsp;- Our client in the Haulage industry&nbsp;is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Reports to: Managing Director
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The General Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations, strategic planning, and financial performance of the haulage company.
	The GM will ensure smooth logistics, fleet management, staff productivity, compliance with transportation laws, and cost-efficient operations.
	This role demands strong leadership, logistics knowledge, and a track record in transport or related industries.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Develop and implement operational strategies to improve efficiency and productivity.
	Ensure all vehicles are properly maintained, serviced, and roadworthy at all times.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual performance and financial reports for senior management.
	Oversee accurate record-keeping of vehicle documentation, staff records, and delivery logs.
	Lead response to emergencies, vehicle accidents, or delivery disruptions.
	Coordinate fleet scheduling to minimize downtime and maximize resource use.
	Foster a productive work culture and ensure staff adherence to company policies.
	Ensure compliance with all transport laws, safety standards, and government regulations.
	Coordinate with law enforcement, insurance companies, and internal teams to resolve issues.


Qualification &amp; Requirements


	B.Sc. in Logistics, Business Administration, Transport Management, or related field (MBA is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5&ndash;8 years of experience in haulage, logistics, or fleet operations (at least 3 years in senior management).
	Proven ability to lead and manage cross-functional teams.
	Strong knowledge of haulage systems, GPS tracking, fleet analytics, and logistics software.
	Sound knowledge of regulatory requirements in road transport and haulage.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and analytical skills.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and execution
	Cost control and resource optimization
	Crisis and conflict management
	Strong organizational and planning skills


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 Monthly.

General Manager Job at Quest Realtor & Consulting Services




        
    

        
        Quest Realtor & Consulting Services - Our client in the Haulage industry is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager
Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Reports to: Managing Director
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The General Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations, strategic planning, and financial performance of the haulage company.
	The GM will ensure smooth logistics, fleet management, staff productivity, compliance with transportation laws, and cost-efficient operations.
	This role demands strong leadership, logistics knowledge, and a track record in transport or related industries.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Develop and implement operational strategies to improve efficiency and productivity.
	Ensure all vehicles are properly maintained, serviced, and roadworthy at all times.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual performance and financial reports for senior management.
	Oversee accurate record-keeping of vehicle documentation, staff records, and delivery logs.
	Lead response to emergencies, vehicle accidents, or delivery disruptions.
	Coordinate fleet scheduling to minimize downtime and maximize resource use.
	Foster a productive work culture and ensure staff adherence to company policies.
	Ensure compliance with all transport laws, safety standards, and government regulations.
	Coordinate with law enforcement, insurance companies, and internal teams to resolve issues.


Qualification & Requirements


	B.Sc. in Logistics, Business Administration, Transport Management, or related field (MBA is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5–8 years of experience in haulage, logistics, or fleet operations (at least 3 years in senior management).
	Proven ability to lead and manage cross-functional teams.
	Strong knowledge of haulage systems, GPS tracking, fleet analytics, and logistics software.
	Sound knowledge of regulatory requirements in road transport and haulage.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and analytical skills.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and execution
	Cost control and resource optimization
	Crisis and conflict management
	Strong organizational and planning skills


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
